definition: one falls, the next follows (idiom); stepping into the breach to replace fallen comrades/advancing wave upon wave
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
to fall forward/to fall prostrate
back/behind/rear/afterwards/after/later/post-
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards

sentences.english: All the people who were standing fell over , piling up on.
sentences.chinese: 站立的人前仆後繼，疊在他人身上。

definition: to be drowned (figurative and literal)
striving to be first and fearing to be last (idiom); outdoing one another
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
cheering excitedly (idiom)/jubilant
lit. fight minutes, snatch seconds (idiom); a race against time/making every second count
to come thick and fast (idiom)
like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
to advance gradually and entrench oneself at every step/to consolidate at every step
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to boss people around (idiom)
to be chivalrous
to keep on fighting despite continual setbacks (idiom)
to advance dauntlessly in wave upon wave (idiom)
to charge and break through enemy lines
(abbr. for 嘗試錯誤|尝试错误) trial and error/failure
